title: Starfield NPCs keep getting bodied mid-sentence and it never isn't funny to me
description: My favorite Bethesda game quirk is how the world keeps trying to kill and maim everyone while they have conversations.

title: Starfield mod turns space travel into an actual series of loading screens by getting rid of all the ship landing and take-off scenes
description: Make space hassle free.

title: I've played the Star Trek game of my dreams, and it's a grand strategy game
description: Star Trek: Infinite mashes Stellaris and Star Trek together into something more delicious than anything you can get out of a replicator.

title: Rust adds attack helicopters, homing missiles to blow up attack helicopters, parachutes to escape exploding attack helicopters
description: The new Rust update makes life in the sky a lot more interesting.

title: Inspired by Starfield food physics, I have run my own tests to determine that cuboid foods rule
description: Heard you all like watching food move.

title: Starfield breaks 1 million concurrent players across all platforms: A 'great milestone,' Phil Spencer says
description: Is it really, though? Well, it depends.

title: Starfield needs a spaceship sharing feature, stat
description: I love looking at player-made ships, but what I really want to do is download them and fly them myself.

title: Starfield player tricks AI with 'unbeatable ship' made only of corners
description: The silver bullet to Starfield's enemy AI? Empty space.

title: Starfield mod enables Starfield achievements that were disabled by Starfield mods
description: Bethesda's new interstellar RPG disables achievements in modded games, so modders did what they do best.

title: Bomb Rush Cyberfunk review
description: Bomb Rush Cyberfunk surfs the Y2K nostalgia wave in style.

title: Baldur's Gate 3's NPC painter has a mysterious mind: I asked for a portrait of myself and he gave me 9 paintings of my jacked druid companion instead
description: Working as intended?

title: RuneScape developer firefights desperately as new battle pass leads to player revolt and review bombing: 'They've gone too far down the rabbit hole'
description: Still, always a bit odd to see negative reviews from players with thousands of hours.

title: Hammerwatch 2 is just the right micro-RPG for the moment
description: There are some great 30 minute dungeon runs in your future if you've got tolerance for—or enjoy—old school tropes.

title: PC Gamer Chat Log Episode 28: The overhyped, the underhyped and the perfectly hyped
description: Lauren and Mollie talk about "overhyped" games, whatever that means. Plus some games that deserved more attention.

title: How to sell ships in Starfield
description: Hawk your spare or stolen vessels for some cash.

title: Okay game marketing, you win this round because this custom Starfield PC is stunning
description: So, turns out I'm a complete sucker for marketing.

title: Japanese court throws the book at YouTuber who uploaded copyrighted game clips and spoilers: Two years in the slammer and ¥1m fine
description: Japan's copyright protection agency really hates spoilers.

title: Larian Studios' Swen Vincke is loving players' systems-based hijinks in Baldur's Gate 3: 'everybody knows about the Owlbear now'
description: The bear is the word.

title: Nintendo Switch 2 reportedly uses Nvidia's DLSS to boost frame rates
description: Behind closed doors developer demo of the upcoming hardware at Gamescom highlights Nvidia hardware.

title: No one say the 'S' word: Google's trying out gaming again, this time with bite-sized games on YouTube
description: Stadia? Never knew her.

title: Where to sell all your space junk in Starfield
description: Stockpile some creds and declutter that hold.

title: If you've ever wanted Megan Fox to literally kick your skeleton out of your body, then boy does Mortal Kombat 1 have a fighter for you
description: Nitara the vampire returns to the series.

title: Todd Howard asked on-air why Bethesda didn't optimise Starfield for PC: 'We did [...] you may need to upgrade your PC'
description: "We really do push the technology."

title: Starfield's ungodly hallway spaceship has already been dethroned by the Borg cube, which hangs in the air the same way bricks don't
description: Resistance is futile.

title: Sapphire Pulse RX 7700 XT Review
description: A capable card that's overshadowed by its big brother.

title: Intel follows Apple's lead with Meteor Lake chip with on-package memory
description: One day we might see on-package DRAM, even.

title: Baldur's Gate 3 has ruined Starfield for me
description: Bethesda's latest can't help but feel shallow by comparison.

title: Meet Astarion and Lae'zel at the Insomnia Gaming Festival this weekend
description: The beloved Baldur's Gate 3 companions, and much more, will be in attendance, and we've got some last-second tickets you can win.

description: Help with the #810 Wordle if you need it.

title: NYT Connections puzzle hint and answers for Thursday, September 7 (#88)
description: The work week's almost over, so give yourself a little break and let us help with Thursday's NYT Connections.

title: They found him: Bethesda's most prolific voice actor returns in Starfield
description: "Nobody breaks the law on my watch!"
